content:
Chemotherapeutic agents inducing DSBs can paradoxically promote secondary neoplasms in survivors by causing mutations in non-target cells, and mutational signature analysis post-therapy can predict secondary cancer risk.  
*Supporting evidence:* Secondary malignancies arise after DNA-damaging therapies [Morton 2014]. Therapy-induced mutational signatures are detectable in secondary cancers [Pich 2019, Nat Genet].

---
